image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Ohio; born in Mount Vernon, Knox County, Ohio, July 16, 1824; attended the common schools; studied law; was admitted to the bar in July 1845 and practiced; judge of the court of common pleas of the sixth judicial district in 1856; reelected in 1861; again elected in 1868, and served until 1873; resumed the practice of law; unsuccessful Democratic candidate for judge of the State supreme court in 1872; resumed the practice of law in Mansfield; elected as a Democrat to the Forty-sixth and to the three succeeding Congresses (March 4, 1879-March 3, 1887); chairman, Committee on War Claims (Forty-eighth and Forty-ninth Congresses); declined to be a candidate for reelection in 1886 to the Fiftieth Congress; resumed the practice of his profession; died in Mansfield, Richland County, Ohio, November 9, 1892; interment in Mansfield Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Geddes, George Washington. Speech of Hon. George W. Geddes, of Ohio, in the House of Representatives, Tuesday, April 29, 1884. Washington: [Government Printing Office], 1884.

researchRecord.name: In the Charles Baldwin Sedgwick Papers, 1814-1891, 1.75 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include George W. Geddes. An unpublished guide to the papers is available in the repository.

recordLocation.name: Manuscript Collections, George Arents Research Library for Special Collections
